hypothesis_content.title: ETH/BTC Ratio Reversion After 5-Day Extreme Deviation
hypothesis_content.statement: When the ETH/BTC ratio (ETH price / BTC price) deviates by more than 2.5 standard deviations from its 30-day rolling mean, it will revert at least 50% of the deviation over the next 5 trading days, regardless of regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: The ETH/BTC ratio tends to oscillate around a slowly-changing equilibrium. Extreme deviations often represent temporary sentiment imbalances (e.g., ETH hype or BTC dominance spikes) that correct as capital rebalances. This relationship has shown historical mean-reverting properties.
entry_conditions: Enter short ratio if z-score > +2.5, long ratio if z-score < -2.5

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio returns to within 1.25 standard deviations of mean OR 50% of the extreme deviation is captured

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the ratio continues trending in the direction of the initial deviation more than 40% of the time after a >2.5 sigma move, indicating a structural break or regime change in the relationship.
